translated: paṭalī, parīśaka, gandha-dhanu-skari, suma, mango, rose-apple, and jasmine, and various other extremely fragrant flowers.

original: sa bla na gnam gyi gnod sbyin drang srong gi cha byad kyis lam sbyong bar byed do //

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu'ang drang srong gi cha byad kyis lam gyi ma gnyis la lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyal mtshan mchog 'dzin to //

original: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog de dag la lha rdzas kyi gos dang / do shal dang / rgyan rab tu 'byang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog de dag la lha rdzas kyi gos dang / do shal dang / rgyan rab tu 'byang ngo //

original: 'phrul dga'i lha'i bu'ang drang srong gi cha byad kyis lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna bdun gyi @252b khang bu brtsegs ma mngon par sprul to //

translated: They are intent on the suffering of their own bodies and minds in order to perfect the view of nihilism, the view that the world beyond does not exist, the view of eternalism and the view of annihilation, and in order to have compassion for beings who have perfected those views.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sems can gcig kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rab tu mos par nus pa dang / dge ba @279a *//

translated: In order to ripen all sentient beings, they are able to inspire even a single sentient being to aspire to the six perfections.🔽And for the sake of each and every sentient being, they are able to plant the seeds of virtue with even a single path of action, and to make them grow, and to make themselves understood with even a single well-spoken statement.

original: bcu'i las kyi lam la las kyi lam gcig gis kyang sa bon bskyed cing 'dug pa dang / legs par smras pa gcig gis kyang rna bar go bar nus pas sems can re re'i phyir yang sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po rnam pa du ma sna tshogs su mngon par brtson no //

translated: “Noble son,

translated: Son of noble family, when bodhisattvas, through their extremely stable diligence, are motivated and have the courage to strive for the six perfections and cultivate loving kindness, they bring to maturity those sentient beings who are destitute, who are associated with the roots of non-virtue,

analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spangs pa dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad las bkar ba'i sems can yongs su smin par byed do //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //

translated: The perfection of meditation is the meditation of the bodhisattva who, having given up all things, does not engage in any activity.

translated: The perfection of wisdom is the wisdom of the bodhisattva who, having given up all things, does not think about his own mind, and who, indifferent to things, does not expect a reward for his generosity.

original: @280a *// rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: @280a *// rnam par mi rtog /

translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva's acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, which is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pas /
translated: Since he does not desire the maturation of the desire realm,

original: sbyin pa byin pa'i rgyun bcad pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pas sbyin pa'i rgyun bcad pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis mtshan nyid la mi 'jug pa dang / dran pa'i stobs mi skye mi 'gog pa la dmigs pas sbyin pa byin pa 'di'ang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa'i rgyun bcad pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pas sbyin pa'i rgyun bcad pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis mtshan nyid la mi 'jug pa dang / dran pa'i stobs mi skye mi 'gog pa la dmigs pas sbyin pa byin pa 'di'ang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: he cuts off the continuity of giving. Similarly, since he does not desire the maturation of the form and formless realms, he cuts off the continuity of giving. Since he does not engage in the characteristics of effort, and since he does not observe the arising and cessation of the power of mindfulness, this giving is the perfection of morality.

original: gang sbyin pa ni /🔽g-yeng ba'i mtshan nyid dang / dran pa'i yul la yang dag par rgyas pa dang / len pa dang dor ba med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi yul la mi khom par dmigs shing snyems pa med pa 'di ni //
analyzed: gang sbyin pa ni / g-yeng ba'i mtshan nyid dang / dran pa'i yul la yang dag par rgyas pa dang / len pa dang dor ba med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi yul la mi khom par dmigs shing snyems pa med pa 'di ni //
translated: Whatever giving

original: bzod pa'i pha rol @280b tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol @280b tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is the characteristic of distraction, the expansion of the domain of mindfulness, the domain of the nature that is neither grasped nor rejected, the observation of leisure, and the absence of conceit, this is the perfection of patience.

original: gang yang sbyin pa de dmigs pa thams cad kun ldang ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i ye shes dang / rnam par spyod pas lam mi mthun pa yongs su spangs pa'i ye shes dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la reg pa med pa'i ye shes dang /

translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva’s generosity is the wisdom of the application of mindfulness that arises from all references; the wisdom of the avoidance of incompatible paths through spiritual practice; the wisdom of the avoidance of the paths of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas;

original: dma' zhing rab tu nyams pa'i lam dang / tshig pas gdungs pa rnams snying rje thams cad kyis yongs su bskyabs te zhi ba'i lam du gzhag pa dang / dban par spyod pa la bdag bde bar skyed cing theg pa chen po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dma' zhing rab tu nyams pa'i lam dang / tshig pas gdungs pa rnams snying rje thams cad kyis yongs su bskyabs te zhi ba'i lam du gzhag pa dang / dban par spyod pa la bdag bde bar skyed cing theg pa chen po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa 'di ni /
translated: the wisdom of the protection of all beings through compassion, placing them on the path of peace, and establishing them on the path of the Great Vehicle; the wisdom of the generation of happiness for oneself through the practice of generosity, and the wisdom of the protection of the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s perfection of generosity.

original: gang sbyin pa de las thams cad mtshan nyid mtshungs shing yul thams cad ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs pas stong pa'i grong bzhin du rtog pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad la blo med cing dngos po med par rtog pa dang / 'dod chags thams cad rkyen la rag las shing bla na med pa dang /
analyzed: gang sbyin pa de las thams cad mtshan nyid mtshungs shing yul thams cad ting nge 'dzin bsgrubs pas stong pa'i grong bzhin du rtog pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad la blo med cing dngos po med par rtog pa dang / 'dod chags thams cad rkyen la rag las shing bla na med pa dang /
translated: All desires are dependent on conditions and are unsurpassed.🔽All concepts are without a body and disintegrate in an instant.

original: rtog pa thams cad lus med mtshan nyid skad cig tu 'jig pa dang / gnas thams cad yod pa ma yin zhing mi 'gro rnam par mi 'gro /
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad lus med mtshan nyid skad cig tu 'jig pa dang / gnas thams cad yod pa ma yin zhing mi 'gro rnam par mi 'gro /
translated: All abodes are unreal and do not go or move.

original: kun nas mi ldang ba'i mtshan nyid du rtog pa 'di ni /
analyzed: kun nas mi ldang ba'i mtshan nyid du rtog pa 'di ni /
translated: They are realized to be without characteristics.🔽This is the bodhisattva’s perfection of concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;gang sbyin pa de bdag la sems pa dang / dben par sems pa dang / rnam par smin pa 'dod par sems pa dang / len pa rnam par rtog par sems pa de las 'dod pa'i khams kyi @281a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;gang sbyin pa de bdag la sems pa dang / dben par sems pa dang / rnam par smin pa 'dod par sems pa dang / len pa rnam par rtog par sems pa de las 'dod pa'i khams kyi @281a *//
translated: “Whatever is given is realized to be the mind that thinks of the self, the mind that thinks of solitude, the mind that thinks of the desire for ripening, and the mind that thinks of the conceptualization of the receiver.

original: phung po la mi gnas pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / sa'i khams la len pa dang dor ba med pa'i sbyin pa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: phung po la mi gnas pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / sa'i khams la len pa dang dor ba med pa'i sbyin pa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i sbyin pa dang /
translated: It is generosity that does not dwell on the aggregates, that is a generosity of not accepting or rejecting the earth element, and that is a generosity of not accepting or rejecting the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dul ba'i phyir mi rtog cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyin pa dang / phung po dang / khams la nam mkha' kun nas ldang ba dang / gzugs kyi rang bzhin la rnam par mi dmigs pa dang / rna ba dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dul ba'i phyir mi rtog cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyin pa dang / phung po dang / khams la nam mkha' kun nas ldang ba dang / gzugs kyi rang bzhin la rnam par mi dmigs pa dang / rna ba dang /
translated: It is a generosity that is nonconceptual and non-apprehending in order to tame the hearers and solitary buddhas, and it is a generosity that is free from the mental formations of the aggregates and elements, and that is free from the observation of the nature of form.

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / chos la rang bzhin rnam par mi dmigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / dran pa'i stobs kyis sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mtshan ma rgyun mi bcad pa'i sbyin pa byin pa dang /
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / chos la rang bzhin rnam par mi dmigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / dran pa'i stobs kyis sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mtshan ma rgyun mi bcad pa'i sbyin pa byin pa dang /
translated: generosity that is not fixated on the nature of the nose, tongue, body, mind, consciousness, and phenomena, generosity that is given with the power of mindfulness, generosity that is given with the power of diligence, and generosity that is given without cutting off the continuity of signs due to nonconceptuality.

original: sbyin pa de sgrol ba'i rnam par mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa de sgrol ba'i rnam par mi dmigs /
translated: That generosity is not fixated on liberation.

original: ma skyes ma byung ba'i phyir 'dres pa med cing 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i sbyin pa byin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ma skyes ma byung ba'i phyir 'dres pa med cing 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i sbyin pa byin pa 'di ni /
translated: Because it is unborn and unoriginated, it is generosity that is given without mixing death, transmigration, and birth.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes smras so //
translated: This is called the bodhisatvas’ perfection of wisdom.”

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa de bdag mi shes shing longs spyod thams cad gdon mi za bar 'grub pa bde ba thams cad skye ba la bzod pa 'dren pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis sems can la mtha' thug pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa de bdag mi shes shing longs spyod thams cad gdon mi za bar 'grub pa bde ba thams cad skye ba la bzod pa 'dren pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis sems can la mtha' thug pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa dang /
translated: And that generosity is the effort that is the non-conceptualization and endlessness of sentient beings,🔽and the method of not adopting or rejecting any signs,🔽and the concentration that is not remaining in meditative absorption,🔽and the wisdom that is free from all reference points with regard to the three realms.

original: mtshan ma thams cad la blang pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / bsam gtan la 'dug pa med pa dang / khams @281b gsum la shes rab dang / dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba de dag gi thabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' dong tshe gcig sbyin pa byin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad la blang pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / bsam gtan la 'dug pa med pa dang / khams @281b gsum la shes rab dang / dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba de dag gi thabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' dong tshe gcig sbyin pa byin te /
translated: When the bodhisattvas practice generosity with those methods,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sems bskyed pas yongs su bsngos bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag thams cad la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sems bskyed pas yongs su bsngos bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag thams cad la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: by dedicating it with the generation of that kind of mind, they will abide in all of these six perfections.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dul ba'i phyir shin tu brtan par mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dul ba'i phyir shin tu brtan par mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to train the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, they will have very stable interest.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la reg pa skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la reg pa skyed par mi byed do //
translated: He does not cause them to attain the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: mu stegs can 'dul ba'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad la 'jug go /🔽lta ba log par ni /
analyzed: mu stegs can 'dul ba'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad la 'jug go / lta ba log par ni /
translated: He enters into all the destinies in order to tame the tīrthikas.

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not fall into wrong views.

original: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i las thams cad dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub pa'i dge ba bcu'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo bar byad do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i las thams cad dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub pa'i dge ba bcu'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo bar byad do //
translated: He dedicates all the roots of virtue of the practice of the ten virtues to the attainment of omniscience.

original: bdag gir bya ba'i lta ba thob pa de tshul khrims la nan tan byed cing dka' thub dang / brtul zhugs yang dag par spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba'i lta ba thob pa de tshul khrims la nan tan byed cing dka' thub dang / brtul zhugs yang dag par spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He practices the austerities and observances of the ascetic practices of the view of the self.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sdug bsngal yongs su thar par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sdug bsngal yongs su thar par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates the roots of virtue to the ripening of beings in the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama, and to their liberation from suffering.

original: bdag sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pas skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pas skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: I will not be afraid of the sufferings of the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama.

original: bdag kyang de bzhin du snying rje chen po'i brtson 'grus brtan pa pha rol gnon pa'i smon lam gyi dbang gis der @282a *//
analyzed: bdag kyang de bzhin du snying rje chen po'i brtson 'grus brtan pa pha rol gnon pa'i smon lam gyi dbang gis der @282a *//
translated: In the same way, I will be born in those places through the power of my vow, with the firm diligence of great compassion,

original: bsam bzhin du skye ba mtshungs par 'dzin to //
analyzed: bsam bzhin du skye ba mtshungs par 'dzin to //
translated: and I will take on the same sufferings as those of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will have all the kinds of patience that are necessary to bring all sentient beings to full maturity.

original: skad cig ma'i 'du byed thams cad brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i 'du byed thams cad brtag par bya'o //
translated: I will examine all the formations that arise and pass away in an instant.

original: yul gces pa thams cad yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul gces pa thams cad yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: I will see all the things that are cherished as objects as they really are.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la brtan pa'i brtson 'grus pha rol gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la brtan pa'i brtson 'grus pha rol gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will have the firm diligence of the roots of virtue that are necessary to bring all sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir slob dpon dang slob dpon ma yin pa thams cad la 'jug cing bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir slob dpon dang slob dpon ma yin pa thams cad la 'jug cing bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: They engage with all teachers and non-teachers in order to ripen all sentient beings, and they strive in the yoga of entering and resting in concentration and meditative absorption.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed par brtags nas yul thams cad kyi bdud kyi lam spyod pas bdag tu lta bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed par brtags nas yul thams cad kyi bdud kyi lam spyod pas bdag tu lta bar byed do //
translated: Having realized non-conditioning, they view the self in all the conduct of the māras’ paths in all the realms.

original: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir shes rab 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir shes rab 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They give rise to wisdom in order to tame sentient beings.

original: byis pa'i yul la spyod pa thams cad la'ang bdag tu lta bar byed do //
analyzed: byis pa'i yul la spyod pa thams cad la'ang bdag tu lta bar byed do //
translated: They view the self in all the conduct of the realms of the childish.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las shin tu 'das shing bsam gtan byed do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las shin tu 'das shing bsam gtan byed do //
translated: They transcend all the realms of the world in order to ripen sentient beings and practice concentration.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul gyi spyod pa la yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul gyi spyod pa la yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: They see the conduct of the realms of the world.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will give away all their possessions in order to ripen all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i phyir rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mgu bar bya ba'i phyir rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sir, in order to please all sentient beings,🔽you should give away all your possessions in order to liberate poor sentient beings from their poverty.🔽Noble sir, you should give away all your possessions in order to liberate poor sentient beings from their poverty.

original: rnam pa de @282b lta bu'i sems can gyi go cha dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can dbul po dbul ba las yongs su thar par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de @282b lta bu'i sems can gyi go cha dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can dbul po dbul ba las yongs su thar par bya'o //
translated: Noble sir, this is the armor of sentient beings, the ornament of ripening sentient beings, and the means of attracting sentient beings with the gifts of the bodhisattvas.

original: rig kyi bu; gzhan yang 'di ni /
analyzed: rig kyi bu; gzhan yang 'di ni /
translated: “Moreover, noble sir,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sbyin pa byin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sbyin pa byin pa 'di ni /
translated: this giving of gifts to the bodhisattvas in order to ripen sentient beings

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is the perfection of generosity.

original: ji lta bur bsam pas sems can yongs su mgu bar byed pa dang / yang na ni /
analyzed: ji lta bur bsam pas sems can yongs su mgu bar byed pa dang / yang na ni /
translated: This is how you please sentient beings with your thoughts, and also with your actions.

original: zang zing gi bsam pa'i sems can rnams zang zing gis yongs su smin par byed pa dang / chos 'dod pa'i sems can rnams ji lta bur sems can rnams la gzugs dang mthun par chos bstan pas yongs su mgu bar byed cing /
analyzed: zang zing gi bsam pa'i sems can rnams zang zing gis yongs su smin par byed pa dang / chos 'dod pa'i sems can rnams ji lta bur sems can rnams la gzugs dang mthun par chos bstan pas yongs su mgu bar byed cing /
translated: The bodhisattva's perfection of generosity is also the full maturation of sentient beings through material generosity for those sentient beings who are motivated by material things, and through the Dharma for those sentient beings who are motivated by the Dharma, by pleasing them with the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with their minds.

original: yongs su smin par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽rigs kyi bu /🔽gzhan yang sems can yongs su smin pas zang zing gi sbyin pa'ang sbyin pa'i len pa de dag la byams pa dang mthun par sems bskyed par bya ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // rigs kyi bu / gzhan yang sems can yongs su smin pas zang zing gi sbyin pa'ang sbyin pa'i len pa de dag la byams pa dang mthun par sems bskyed par bya ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, the bodhisattvas' perfection of generosity is also the full maturation of sentient beings through material generosity.🔽Those who receive material generosity should generate a mind that accords with loving-kindness, and through that very [mind] they bring them to full maturation.🔽Those who receive the gift of the Dharma should generate a mind that accords with sympathetic joy, and through that very [mind] they bring them to full maturation.

original: rab tu dga' ba skye ba'i blo dang ldan pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba skye ba'i blo dang ldan pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Those who receive the gift of protection should generate a mind that accords with equanimity, and through that very [mind] they bring them to full maturation.

original: snying rje ci bya'o cog byed pa la brtson pa dag ba'i sems skye ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje ci bya'o cog byed pa la brtson pa dag ba'i sems skye ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also be diligent in doing whatever is necessary for those who are compassionate.

original: btang snyoms shing sdig pa mi byed pa dge ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: btang snyoms shing sdig pa mi byed pa dge ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They will be impartial and not do anything wrong.🔽They will be in harmony with meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang @283a *//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang @283a *//
translated: They will be in harmony with the Dharma.🔽They will rely on the meaning, and their minds will be imbued with the absence of self.🔽They will be in harmony with the perfections.🔽They will be in harmony with the levels.

original: mthun pa dang ldan pa sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: mthun pa dang ldan pa sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They will be in harmony with the meditative absorption of the noble ones.🔽They will be in harmony with the doors to liberation.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the infinite.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the compounded.

original: don la rton pa bdag med pa dang ldan pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //🔽de'ang sbyin pa byin pa'i len pa rnams kyi sems dang bsam pa la dang por byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: don la rton pa bdag med pa dang ldan pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //🔽de'ang sbyin pa byin pa'i len pa rnams kyi sems dang bsam pa la dang por byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the uncompounded.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the infinite.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the compounded.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the uncompounded.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the infinite.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the compounded.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the uncompounded.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the infinite.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the compounded.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the uncompounded.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the infinite.🔽They will be in harmony with the emptiness of the compounded.🔽They will be in harmony with

original: la la len pa rnams la byang chub sbyad pa spyod pa de dag skyo ba skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: la la len pa rnams la byang chub sbyad pa spyod pa de dag skyo ba skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Some, by causing weariness in those who are practicing the perfections, they bring them to maturity.

original: la la'ang yun ring po nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la spyod pa'i rgyun bcad cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos ston cing rab tu ston pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do
analyzed: la la'ang yun ring po nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la spyod pa'i rgyun bcad cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos ston cing rab tu ston pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do
translated: Some, by teaching and demonstrating the Dharma in such a way that those who have been practicing the bodhisattva deeds for a long time cut off the stream of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, they bring them to maturity.

original: // la la'ang phyir mi ldog pa rnams la ji lta bur skyes bu dam pa ting nge 'dzin dang / bzod pa'i gzungs thob pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang ldan pa rnam pa de lta bu'i chos ston cing rab tu ston pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: // la la'ang phyir mi ldog pa rnams la ji lta bur skyes bu dam pa ting nge 'dzin dang / bzod pa'i gzungs thob pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang ldan pa rnam pa de lta bu'i chos ston cing rab tu ston pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //

analyzed: la la'ang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi @283b zhing yongs su dag pa rnams rgyun bcad cing nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du snying rje chen po skyed pa de lta bu'i chos ston cing rab tu ston pa de ni /
translated: Some, who are bodhisattvas, are ripened by the teaching and demonstration of the Dharma that is endowed with the great compassion that arises in the buddha-field of the bodhisattvas who have cut off the pure buddha-fields and given rise to great compassion in the buddha-field of the five corruptions and afflictions.

original: smon lam byed do //

analyzed: de na sems can tshul khrims dang bral ba rnams byang chub sems dpa'i ngag snyan pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos pos 'phags pa'i tshul khrims la ji ltar 'god par byed; yang byang chub sems dpa' bden pa'i tshig mi rtsub pa de'i drung du slong ba po nye bar phyin
translated: When a bodhisattva, with truthful and gentle words, approaches those beings who are beggars,

analyzed: sangs rgyas la mi phyed par rab tu mos pa la rab tu gzhog par byed /

translated: They connect them to the lay practitioner’s precepts, the renunciate’s precepts, and the noble worldly and transcendent moralities,

original: 'god par @285b byed do; ;dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni /
analyzed: 'god par @285b byed do; ;dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni /

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims 'phags pa'i slob pa la sdom pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims 'phags pa'i slob pa la sdom pa ni /
translated: The morality of the world is the restraint of the disciple of the noble ones.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: The morality of the world beyond is the morality of the other world.

original: mu stegs can gzhan gyi tshul khrims kyis ngan song gsum du 'gro ba'i sems can dag gang gis lha dang mir skye ba thob pa'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can la mngon par 'god par byed do //

translated: By means of the morality of the other world, he establishes in the world those beings who are going to the three bad destinies, in the morality of the world, which is the attainment of birth as a god or human.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams la'ang de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams la'ang de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //

translated: He establishes those beings who have entered the morality of the world in the morality of the restraint of the disciple of the noble ones.

translated: And he brings to maturity those who have attained the fruit of the uncontaminated path by means of that very morality.

original: sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor bar byed pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //

translated: They bring to maturity those sentient beings who are followers of the Śrāvakayāna and connect them with the Pratyekabuddhayāna.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi yul pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi tshul khrims la sbyor bar byed; 'god par byed pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //

translated: They bring to maturity those who are followers of the Pratyekabuddhayāna and connect them with the conduct of the six perfections, which is the domain of the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la sbyor bar byed do //

translated: Skilled in means, the bodhisattvas connect those sentient beings who are followers of the Śrāvakayāna and the Pratyekabuddhayāna with the noble bodhisattva conduct.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble sir,

analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /

original: sems can pha rol la gnod pa @286a *//
analyzed: sems can pha rol la gnod pa @286a *//
translated: It is the absence of harm to other sentient beings.

original: can gyi nang na byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la gnod pa med par gnas pa dang / sems can ma byin par len pa can rnams kyi nang na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi nor la mi rku ba'i sems kyis gnas pa nas pha rol gyi chung ma la mi g-yem pa dang /
analyzed: can gyi nang na byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la gnod pa med par gnas pa dang / sems can ma byin par len pa can rnams kyi nang na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi nor la mi rku ba'i sems kyis gnas pa nas pha rol gyi chung ma la mi g-yem pa dang /
translated: Among those who take what is not given, the bodhisattva abides with a mind that does not steal others’ wealth, up to not engaging in sexual misconduct with another’s spouse,

original: brdzun du smra ba la mi slu ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la mi slu ba'i bar du'o //
translated: and not deceiving with false speech.

original: sems can thams cad la phra ma mi zer ba nas ngag mi rtsub pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phra ma mi zer ba nas ngag mi rtsub pa'i bar du ste /
translated: He does not speak divisively to any sentient being, up to not speaking harshly.

original: tshig kyal pa zer ba spangs pa dang / gnod sems 'dod pa spangs pa dang / chags sems spangs pa dang / sems kyi rnyog pa spang ba'i phyir gzhan gyi bstan pa spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan la gus par bya ba la mi zad par mos shing nyan par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: tshig kyal pa zer ba spangs pa dang / gnod sems 'dod pa spangs pa dang / chags sems spangs pa dang / sems kyi rnyog pa spang ba'i phyir gzhan gyi bstan pa spangs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan la gus par bya ba la mi zad par mos shing nyan par 'dod pa dang /
translated: He abandons idle speech, abandons the desire for malice, abandons covetousness, and abandons mental disturbance. He abandons teaching others, and with inexhaustible interest and desire to listen, he is devoted to the qualities of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: bslab pa la mi zad par gus pa skyes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba cung zad tsam la 'jigs par lta ba dang / theg pa gzhan mi 'dod pas tshul khrims ma zhig pa dang / ma rung ba skye ba la yang dag par gnas pa rnams skyo bas tshul khrims ma ral ba dang /
analyzed: bslab pa la mi zad par gus pa skyes pa dang / kha na ma tho ba cung zad tsam la 'jigs par lta ba dang / theg pa gzhan mi 'dod pas tshul khrims ma zhig pa dang / ma rung ba skye ba la yang dag par gnas pa rnams skyo bas tshul khrims ma ral ba dang /
translated: They are: respect for the precepts which is never exhausted; seeing danger in even the slightest fault; not violating the precepts by not desiring any other vehicle; not breaking the precepts out of disgust with the world, even when born in an evil world;

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs pas tshul khrims 'dres pa med pa dang / chos dkar po 'phel bas mkhas pas mi smod pa dang / dran pas smra ba dang / ting nge 'dzin kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dbang po drug srung ba dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs pas tshul khrims 'dres pa med pa dang / chos dkar po 'phel bas mkhas pas mi smod pa dang / dran pas smra ba dang / ting nge 'dzin kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / dbang po drug srung ba dang /
translated: not mixing the precepts with the propensities of the passions; not being reproached by the wise because of the increase of good qualities; speaking with mindfulness; having a concentration free from evil; guarding the six senses;

original: 'dod pa dang chags sems kyi 'dod pa rab tu spangs la bsam pa @286b bsngags pa'o //🔽lha dang mi mngon par mos par bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang 'thab mo'i 'du 'dzi can yongs su spangs pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang chags sems kyi 'dod pa rab tu spangs la bsam pa @286b bsngags pa'o //🔽lha dang mi mngon par mos par bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang 'thab mo'i 'du 'dzi can yongs su spangs pa de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: and having a pure will, having abandoned the will for desire and attachment.🔽They are: not being attached to the pleasures of this life; and not being attached to the pleasures of samsara.🔽They are: not being attached to one's own happiness; and being attached to the happiness of others.

original: sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir sems can snying rje med pa'i nang na 'dug pa la byams pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir sems can snying rje med pa'i nang na 'dug pa la byams pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to protect sentient beings, he practices loving kindness toward those who are without compassion.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa'i sems dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba la zhum pa med pa'i sems dang / bdag 'khrul pa'i phyir 'byin pa dang / gzhan 'khrul pa la rtsod cing 'dor ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa'i sems dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba la zhum pa med pa'i sems dang / bdag 'khrul pa'i phyir 'byin pa dang / gzhan 'khrul pa la rtsod cing 'dor ba de nyid kyis de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He has the attitude of enduring all suffering, the attitude of not being discouraged about going to the lower realms, and he is not discouraged about the long duration of the three periods of time.🔽In this buddha-field, which is afflicted by the five degenerations, he is the only one who has the attitude of not abandoning sentient beings, who has the attitude of not abandoning the buddha-field, who has the attitude of enduring the arising of the afflictions, and who has the attitude of enduring the arising of the root of the afflictions.🔽He is the only one who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the perfections, who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the factors of enlightenment, and who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir sems can mtha' med par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / le lo can dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa'i nang na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir sems can mtha' med par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / le lo can dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa'i nang na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is the only one who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, and the emptiness of the inner and outer, and who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of the great, the ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the past, the future, and the present, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of non-existent intrinsic nature, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of non-existent essential nature, and the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽He is the only one who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five spiritual faculties, the five strengths, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.🔽He is the only one who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the four noble truths, the three gateways to liberation, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten universal bases, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He is the only one who has the attitude of not abandoning the practice of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessness

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa'i las dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa'i las dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to purify body, speech, and mind, they will apply diligence to the roots of virtue of discipline, learning, generosity, concentration, the immeasurables, and the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i phung po nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi lta ba kun tu sbyor ba dang / tshul 'chos pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshan ma dang / 'jig tshogs kyi mtshan ma dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba yongs su sbyang ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i phung po nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi lta ba kun tu sbyor ba dang / tshul 'chos pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshan ma dang / 'jig tshogs kyi mtshan ma dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba yongs su sbyang ba dang /
translated: In order to purify the aggregates of the desire, form, and formless realms, the fetters of the latent tendencies of afflictions, hypocrisy, the signs of latent tendencies, the signs of the view of the transitory collection, and the view grasping at the extremes,

original: @287a *// rab tu spangs pa'i phyir rtsol ba de dang de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la'ang sems sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: @287a *// rab tu spangs pa'i phyir rtsol ba de dang de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la'ang sems sbyor bar byed /
translated: they will apply diligence to the roots of virtue and will train their minds in those and those roots of virtue.

original: 'god par byed pa de nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ste; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: 'god par byed pa de nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ste; rigs kyi bu /
translated: By that very application, they will bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus dang tshul khrims kyi sems kyi go cha la brtson pa 'di'ang 'jig rten pa'i ngag snyan pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus dang tshul khrims kyi sems kyi go cha la brtson pa 'di'ang 'jig rten pa'i ngag snyan pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: This is also a worldly means of attracting disciples, the armor of the bodhisattvas' minds of effort and morality in order to ripen beings.

original: gang gis go cha'i thabs la mkhas pas nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' skyes bu chen po'i rtsal gyis sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang /
analyzed: gang gis go cha'i thabs la mkhas pas nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' skyes bu chen po'i rtsal gyis sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang /
translated: By means of the skillful means of the armor, in this buddha-field of the five corruptions and afflictions, the bodhisattvas, through the power of great beings, ripen beings who commit the immediate [evil] acts, abandon the true Dharma, and slander the noble ones.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig 'grogs pa dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig 'grogs pa dag yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They befriend those with roots of nonvirtue.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag par byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bu'i rtsal yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag par byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i skyes bu'i rtsal yod do //
translated: Just as in impure buddha-fields, bodhisattvas have such power of great beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i tshe gzhung 'dis gang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa spyod cing snying rje chen po dang ldan pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhung 'dis gang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa spyod cing snying rje chen po dang ldan pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: At that time, this scripture says, “The bodhisattvas who practice the six perfections in a buddha-field that is a buddha-field of afflictions and five turbidities, and who are endowed with great compassion, should be known as bodhisattvas.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ba spu'i khung bu ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ngag snyan pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ba spu'i khung bu ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ngag snyan pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: A bodhisattva, with as many pleasant words of skillful means as there are pores in his body, brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de @287b la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang / don bya ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de @287b la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang / don bya ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: what is the supramundane morality of the bodhisattvas, and the skillful means of bringing sentient beings to maturity and accomplishing their aims?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' brtan pa'i snying rje chen pos bcings pa dang / bdag gi smon lam gyi khyad par gyis bcings pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' brtan pa'i snying rje chen pos bcings pa dang / bdag gi smon lam gyi khyad par gyis bcings pa ni /
translated: “In this buddha realm, which is afflicted by afflictions and the five degenerations, the bodhisattvas are bound by great compassion and bound by the particularities of my aspirations.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are like this:🔽They are bound by great compassion, and they are bound by the particularities of my aspirations.🔽They are like this:

original: dper na; phyugs shing la btags pa ltar sdug bsngal myong bas na sems dang bsam pa la 'jig pa'am /
analyzed: dper na; phyugs shing la btags pa ltar sdug bsngal myong bas na sems dang bsam pa la 'jig pa'am /
translated: They are like cattle tied to a post, and they experience suffering, but their minds and thoughts are not destroyed,

original: skrag pa'am / yongs su bsdigs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skrag pa'am / yongs su bsdigs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: terrified, or threatened by it.

original: de chung ngu na sems kyi skad cig gcig gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po 'di sgom pa na de ltar bslab bo //
analyzed: de chung ngu na sems kyi skad cig gcig gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po 'di sgom pa na de ltar bslab bo //
translated: Even in a single moment of thought, they should train in this great compassion in order to ripen beings.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They should think like this:🔽‘Are these beings just names?

original: sems can 'di gang sems can 'di ming tsam zhig gam /
analyzed: sems can 'di gang sems can 'di ming tsam zhig gam /
translated: Are these beings just errors?

original: sems can 'di phyin ci log tsam zhig gam /🔽gti mug pa tsam mam /
analyzed: sems can 'di phyin ci log tsam zhig gam / gti mug pa tsam mam /
translated: Are these beings just delusion?

original: tha snyad tsam mam /
analyzed: tha snyad tsam mam /
translated: Are these beings just conventions?

original: thog mar dge ba 'di sems can zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: thog mar dge ba 'di sems can zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Are these beings just initially virtuous?

original: yang dag pa ma yin par gti mug pa ma gtogs par shin tu mngon par mi sgrub pa dang / 'du byed sna tshogs kyi phyin ci log kun nas ldang ba rnams mngon par 'du bya ba na sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba myong ba dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par gti mug pa ma gtogs par shin tu mngon par mi sgrub pa dang / 'du byed sna tshogs kyi phyin ci log kun nas ldang ba rnams mngon par 'du bya ba na sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba myong ba dang /
translated: They are suffering because they are creating the conditions for the experience of suffering and mental unhappiness.

original: 'dus byas thams cad kyi dngos po gar mkhan gyi mtshon 'dra ba dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / rang bzhin gyi smig rgyu lta bu dang / 'khor ba la chags pa rnams bde bar 'dod cing @288a *//
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad kyi dngos po gar mkhan gyi mtshon 'dra ba dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / rang bzhin gyi smig rgyu lta bu dang / 'khor ba la chags pa rnams bde bar 'dod cing @288a *//
translated: They are suffering because all conditioned things are like an actor’s props, like a dream, like a mirage, and yet those who are attached to saṃsāra desire happiness and create the conditions for it.🔽They are suffering because they experience various kinds of suffering due to the conditions they create.

original: mngan par 'du bya ba des sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong ba dang / chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du mi shes pa na kun tu sbyor bas 'khrul pa dang / myos pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi nad 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: mngan par 'du bya ba des sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong ba dang / chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du mi shes pa na kun tu sbyor bas 'khrul pa dang / myos pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi nad 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They are suffering because they do not understand that all phenomena are of the nature of space and so they are confused by their fetters, and various kinds of intoxicating suffering arise.

original: gang gi 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba la 'khor lo stug po lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su 'khor ba de dag kyang bdag cag gis phyin ci log bzhi spangs te /🔽ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba'i lam la dgod par bya zhing yang dag pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis yongs su smin par bya ba zhig snyam pa dang / de sems can rnams la tshul bzhin du rtogs te /
analyzed: gang gi 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba la 'khor lo stug po lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su 'khor ba de dag kyang bdag cag gis phyin ci log bzhi spangs te / ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba'i lam la dgod par bya zhing yang dag pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis yongs su smin par bya ba zhig snyam pa dang / de sems can rnams la tshul bzhin du rtogs te /
translated: We will establish them in the path of peace, having abandoned the four errors.🔽We will ripen them in every way with the true path.

original: sems can rnams la dmigs pa'ang med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dmigs pa'ang med do //
translated: He thinks of sentient beings in this way, but he does not observe sentient beings.

original: srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed can du dmigs pa'ang med do //
analyzed: srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed can du dmigs pa'ang med do //
translated: He does not observe a life-force, a living being, a creature, one born of Manu, or a human.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'ang rnam par mi spang ngo //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'ang rnam par mi spang ngo //
translated: He does not abandon great compassion in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: bstan pa la mos pas sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims la sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: bstan pa la mos pas sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims la sbyor bar byed /
translated: He connects sentient beings to the morality that transcends the world through his interest in the teaching.

original: thabs la mkhas pas 'god par byed /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas 'god par byed /
translated: He establishes them through his skill in means.

original: dgon pa dang / nags 'dabs su 'dug pa'i phyir spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgon pa dang / nags 'dabs su 'dug pa'i phyir spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will practice in solitude, in monasteries and in forests.

original: 'du 'dzi yongs su spang pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la lha dang mi mngon par mos par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi yongs su spang pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la lha dang mi mngon par mos par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be diligent in giving up distractions, and they will be dedicated to the practice of keeping in mind the five grasping heaps in order to inspire gods and humans.

original: gang yang phyag @288b 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / 'du 'dzi spang pa'i phyir sems can de dag gi drung du nye bar phyin nas chos ston te /
analyzed: gang yang phyag @288b 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / 'du 'dzi spang pa'i phyir sems can de dag gi drung du nye bar phyin nas chos ston te /
translated: They will go to those sentient beings in order to teach them the Dharma, so that they may bow down to them, serve them, and give up distractions.

original: bag la nyal ba spang pa'i phyir 'gro ba lnga la mngon par chags pa rjes su smon pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba spang pa'i phyir 'gro ba lnga la mngon par chags pa rjes su smon pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They will connect them to the side of purification, so that they may give up their latent tendencies and not aspire to the five realms.

original: nyes pa mang po'i lta ba dang / nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba dang / rtag pa dang chad pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir dgon pa'i gnas dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis la rab tu gnas par byed pa de dag gi gan du gus pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa mang po'i lta ba dang / nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba dang / rtag pa dang chad pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir dgon pa'i gnas dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis la rab tu gnas par byed pa de dag gi gan du gus pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to abandon the view of many faults, the view of mine, the view of self, eternalism, and nihilism, they will be respectful toward those who abide in the twelve ascetic practices and in the solitary life.

original: de dag la'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims ston par byed pa de ni; sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims 'di'o //
analyzed: de dag la'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims ston par byed pa de ni; sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims 'di'o //
translated: “They will teach them the supramundane discipline that is approved by the buddhas.

original: gang dang ldan pa'i sems can thams cad 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pa'i sems can thams cad 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'jig par byed do //
translated: ‘Those who possess this supramundane discipline will destroy all desire and attachment.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags thams cad 'jig par byed do //
translated: They will destroy all desire and attachment related to the form and formless realms.

original: bag la nyal ba dang / nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba thams cad 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba dang / nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba thams cad 'jig par byed do //
translated: They will destroy all latent tendencies, the view of mine, and the view of self.

original: myur du chos zab mo gting dpag dka' ba'i bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: myur du chos zab mo gting dpag dka' ba'i bzod pa thob bo //
translated: They will quickly attain the acceptance of the profound Dharma that is difficult to fathom.’

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: They will quickly awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sems can 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims can yang dang yang du sdug bsngal gyi zil gyis non cing 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gnas pa nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba la brten pa dag byang chub kyi lam rab tu mi shes so //🔽de bzhin du rdzu @289a *//
analyzed: sems can 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims can yang dang yang du sdug bsngal gyi zil gyis non cing 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gnas pa nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba la brten pa dag byang chub kyi lam rab tu mi shes so // de bzhin du rdzu @289a *//
translated: Sentient beings who have mundane morality, who are repeatedly overwhelmed by suffering, who are situated in the wheel of the five destinies, who are based on what is mine and what is not mine, do not know the path to awakening.

original: 'phrul chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims kyi sems can rnams dgos pa med pa ni /
analyzed: 'phrul chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims kyi sems can rnams dgos pa med pa ni /
translated: Similarly, sentient beings with great magical power and supramundane morality, who have no need,

original: gang na bdag gi gnas med cing sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed can gyi gnas med pa dang / gzugs kyi gnas med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
analyzed: gang na bdag gi gnas med cing sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed can gyi gnas med pa dang / gzugs kyi gnas med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
translated: where there is no basis for a self, and no basis for a sentient being, a living being, a person, a human being, or a human, and no basis for form, feeling, notion,

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i gnas med pa dang / sa'i khams kyi gnas med pa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / mig dang / gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mi gnas shing rna ba dang / sgra'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i gnas med pa dang / sa'i khams kyi gnas med pa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / mig dang / gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mi gnas shing rna ba dang / sgra'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of form, the realm of formlessness, the realm of desire, the realm of humans, the realm of gods, the realm of māras, the realm of Brahmā, the realm of śrāvakas, the realm of pratyekabuddhas, the realm of bodhisattvas, or the realm of buddhas.🔽They do not dwell on the realm of the eye, the realm of form, the realm of visual consciousness, or the realm of visual contact.🔽They do not dwell on the realm of the ear, the realm of sound, the realm of auditory consciousness, or the realm of auditory contact.🔽They do not dwell on the realm of the nose, the realm of smell, the realm of olfactory consciousness, or the realm of olfactory contact.

original: lce dang / ro'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
analyzed: lce dang / ro'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of the tongue, the realm of taste, the realm of gustatory consciousness, or the realm of gustatory contact.

original: lus dang / reg bya'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
analyzed: lus dang / reg bya'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of the body, the realm of touch, the realm of tactile consciousness, or the realm of tactile contact.

original: yid dang / chos kyi mtshan ma la mi gnas /
analyzed: yid dang / chos kyi mtshan ma la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of the mind, the realm of phenomena, the realm of mental consciousness, or the realm of mental contact.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi mtshan ma la mi gnas /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi mtshan ma la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of the body, the realm of speech, or the realm of the mind.

original: nga yir bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma la mi gnas /
analyzed: nga yir bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of the nature of grasping at ‘mine.’

original: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mtshan ma la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of eternalism or the realm of nihilism.

original: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba la mi gnas /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of the view of the transitory collection or the realm of the view grasping at extremes.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / rab tu rtog pa dang / nye bar rtog pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / rab tu rtog pa dang / nye bar rtog pa la mi gnas /
translated: They do not dwell on the realm of concepts, thoughts, notions, assumptions, or postulations.

original: mya ngan dang / nye ba'i mya ngan dang / rjes su mya ngan dang / zad pa'i mya ngan dang / gnyis pa'i mya ngan la mi gnas /
analyzed: mya ngan dang / nye ba'i mya ngan dang / rjes su mya ngan dang / zad pa'i mya ngan dang / gnyis pa'i mya ngan la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on grief, great grief, subsequent grief, grief of exhaustion, or grief of separation.

original: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / khams gsum gyi rgyud la mi gnas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / khams gsum gyi rgyud la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on emptiness, the absence of wishes, the absence of attributes, or the three realms.

original: mngon par 'du mi byad /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byad /
translated: He does not dwell on the absence of conditioning,

original: ma skyes / ma byung /
analyzed: ma skyes / ma byung /
translated: the unborn, the unarisen,

original: ma byas / mngon @289b bar ma byas pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: ma byas / mngon @289b bar ma byas pa la mi gnas /
translated: the uncreated, and the unconditioned.

original: dus gsum la mi gnas /
analyzed: dus gsum la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on the three times.

original: sems dang yid kyi mtshan nyid la mi gnas /
analyzed: sems dang yid kyi mtshan nyid la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on the characteristics of mind and mental cognition.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / tshig pa dang / rjes su tshig pa dang / skad cig tu 'jig pa'i mtha'i rdul la mi gnas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / tshig pa dang / rjes su tshig pa dang / skad cig tu 'jig pa'i mtha'i rdul la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on the end of the destruction of the particles of affliction, purification, anger, subsequent anger, and momentary destruction.

original: mngon par mi shes pa dang / mthun pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa dang / mthun pa la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on the absence of understanding and the absence of harmony.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa sdom pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa sdom pa la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on the vows of the Hearers’ Vehicle.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mi gnas /
translated: He does not dwell on the Solitary Buddhas’ Vehicle.

original: mtshan ma la mi gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug la snyems par mi gnas kyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mi gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa drug la snyems par mi gnas kyi /
translated: They do not dwell on signs, and they do not dwell on conceit with regard to the six perfections.

original: sems dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par spyod pa nam mkha' bzhin du gnas shing yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par spyod pa la mtshungs par gnas so //
analyzed: sems dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par spyod pa nam mkha' bzhin du gnas shing yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par spyod pa la mtshungs par gnas so //
translated: Their mental and mental-object consciousnesses dwell like space, and they dwell equally in correct and incorrect mental and mental-object consciousnesses.

original: zhen pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / chags pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / ye shes gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa na rtog pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang /
analyzed: zhen pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / chags pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / ye shes gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa na rtog pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang /
translated: When they analyze the nonduality of attachment, the nonduality of desire, the nonduality of wisdom, the nonduality of yoga, and the nonduality of the perfections, they analyze the nonduality of concepts.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / lam gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'dren pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / lam gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'dren pa gnyis su med pa rnam par dpyod pa ste /
translated: the nonduality of the two defilements, the nonduality of the two analyses, the nonduality of the two paths, and the nonduality of the two guides of the afflictions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i tshul khrims dang ldan pas rigs kyi bu chos zab mo'i bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i tshul khrims dang ldan pas rigs kyi bu chos zab mo'i bzod pa thob bo //
translated: the son of noble family who possesses such morality attains the profound Dharma patience.

original: thog ma med pa'i stong pa nyid rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i stong pa nyid rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes skilled in the wisdom that discerns beginningless emptiness.

original: shes rab snang @290a *//
analyzed: shes rab snang @290a *//
translated: The light of his wisdom

original: pas byang chub kyi lam rnam par spyod par byed do //
analyzed: pas byang chub kyi lam rnam par spyod par byed do //
translated: purifies the path to awakening.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyis gos pa'ang med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyis gos pa'ang med do //
translated: He is not sullied by worldly dharmas.

original: bdud kyi las kyis gos pa'ang med do //
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyis gos pa'ang med do //
translated: He is not sullied by the activities of Māra.

original: bag chags kyi rjes su 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pas gos pa'ang med do //
analyzed: bag chags kyi rjes su 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pas gos pa'ang med do //
translated: He is not sullied by the afflictions that are related to traces.

original: phyogs bcur shes rab kyi snang bas ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcur shes rab kyi snang bas ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is endowed with the light of wisdom in the ten directions.

original: shes rab kyi stobs skyes pas yul thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ro; ;sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang ba thob par 'gyur ro //🔽'dod chags kyi 'khor bas ldan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / rnam pa byang ba yongs su shes pa dang / chags pa thams cad las yang dag par shin tu 'das pa dang /🔽mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur zhing 'khor ba'i yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs skyes pas yul thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ro; ;sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang ba thob par 'gyur ro // 'dod chags kyi 'khor bas ldan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / rnam pa byang ba yongs su shes pa dang / chags pa thams cad las yang dag par shin tu 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur zhing 'khor ba'i yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: Through the power of wisdom, all objects are known, and the light of all the qualities of the Buddha is obtained.

original: dben pa'i spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing 'du 'dzi thams cad la mngon par chags par yang dag par mthong ngo //🔽bsam gtan gyi spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing btsun mo'i 'khor du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing 'du byed thams cad kyi yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing 'du byed thams cad kyi yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: They are in the domain of non-performance, and yet they see the domain of all the perfections.

original: ma skyes pa'i spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing bdud bzhi'i yul gyi spyod yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing bdud bzhi'i yul gyi spyod yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: They are in the domain of non-birth, and yet they see the domain of the four Maras.

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo'i spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo'i spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are in the domain of the holy ones,

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo'i @290b spyod yul ma yin par yang yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo'i @290b spyod yul ma yin par yang yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: and yet they see the domain of the non-holy.

original: 'jig rten gyi yul las yang dag par shin tu 'das par yang 'gyur zhing 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul gyi spyod yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yul las yang dag par shin tu 'das par yang 'gyur zhing 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul gyi spyod yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: They are beyond the domain of the world, and yet they see the domain of the whole world.

original: ye shes kyi spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing byis pa'i yul gyi spyod yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi spyod yul du'ang 'gyur zhing byis pa'i yul gyi spyod yul du'ang yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: They are in the domain of knowledge, and yet they see the domain of the childish.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i yul mngon du'ang 'gyur zhing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi spyod pa la yang dag par dga' bas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i yul la spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i yul mngon du'ang 'gyur zhing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi spyod pa la yang dag par dga' bas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i yul la spyad pa spyod do //
translated: They will also manifest the object of the limit of reality, and with delight in the object of practice of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, they will practice the object of practice of the bodhisattvas.

original: yul thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i spyod yul la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par byed /
analyzed: yul thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i spyod yul la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par byed /
translated: They will cultivate the perfection of wisdom in the domain of the object that is devoid of characteristics.

original: spyod par byed /
analyzed: spyod par byed /
translated: They will practice.

original: mtshan dang / dpe byad dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul la yang dag par gzhol ba'i rnam par shes pa la brtson pas bdud bzhi'i yul la dbye bar 'jug pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan dang / dpe byad dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul la yang dag par gzhol ba'i rnam par shes pa la brtson pas bdud bzhi'i yul la dbye bar 'jug pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: With the consciousness that is dedicated to the major and minor marks and to the domain of the Buddha, they will understand how to engage in the division of the domain of the four māras.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du nye bar 'gro ba la brtson par 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa'ang byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du nye bar 'gro ba la brtson par 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa'ang byed do //
translated: They will be dedicated to going to all the buddhafields in order to worship and serve the tathāgatas, and they will also perform the teachings of all the tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la'ang 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la'ang 'jug par byed do //
translated: It perfects all the domains of the buddhas and causes one to enter the domain of omniscient wisdom.

original: dmigs pa thams cad kyi dge ba spyod pa la sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad kyi dge ba spyod pa la sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: It causes beings to ripen through the practice of virtue in all its aspects.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par phye mar byed do //🔽spros pa thams cad rab tu 'dod par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par phye mar byed do // spros pa thams cad rab tu 'dod par byed do //
translated: It pulverizes the mountain of afflictions.🔽It eliminates all conceptual elaboration.

original: lta ba thams cad rnam par 'jig par byed do //🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos @291a *//
analyzed: lta ba thams cad rnam par 'jig par byed do // sangs rgyas kyi chos @291a *//
translated: It destroys all views.

original: thams cad la'ang 'god par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad la'ang 'god par byed do //
translated: It establishes all the qualities of the buddhas.
